byline.contributor: Michael Schmidt and Eric Lichtblau contributed reporting from Washington, and Jeremy Merrill from New York.

abstract: Federal Bureau of Investigation director James B Comey says investigation into Hillary Clinton's private server found at least 110 emails containing information that was 'born classified,' and should never have been sent over unsecured network; findings damage Clinton's claim that controversy was based on overzealous after-the-fact classification of emails after they were made public.
lead_paragraph: The F.B.I. director, James B. Comey, undercut many of the arguments Mrs. Clinton has used to play down her use of a private email server while secretary of state.

headline.main: F.B.I. Findings Damage Many of Hillary Clinton’s Claims
headline.print_headline: F.B.I. Findings Damage Many of Clinton’s Claims

snippet: The F.B.I. director, James B. Comey, undercut many of the arguments Mrs. Clinton has used to play down her use of a private email server while secretary of state....
